Yukami.guiAPI

Class guiWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • Yukami.guiAPI.guiWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.event.Listener

    public class guiWindow
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.bukkit.event.Listener

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      guiWindow(org.bukkit.entity.Player p, java.lang.String name, int rows, WindowType type, org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin)
      Creates a Window (an inventory) that can be further customized

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      guiItem addItemStack(org.bukkit.Material mat, java.lang.String name, int slot)
      adds an ItemStack to the window
      void delete()
      Unregisters the window from the Listeners so that the reference can be dumped
      org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory getInv() 
      void setBorder(org.bukkit.Material mat, java.lang.String name)
      If the WindowType is set to Split_2 or Split_4, you can change the border material and name
      void setFillInv(org.bukkit.Material mat)
      Set the FillMaterial for all empty slots of the inventory
      void unregister()
      unregisters the window, useful if you want to save on resources if the window has no need to listens to events for some time

    • Constructor Detail

      • guiWindow

        public guiWindow(org.bukkit.entity.Player p,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 int rows,
                 WindowType type,
                 org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin)
        Creates a Window (an inventory) that can be further customized
        Parameters:
        p - Player of that the inv will be opened to
        name - title of the inventory
        rows - Amount of rows, min. 1, max. 6
        type - WindowType, normal or split
        plugin - Plugin reference

    • Method Detail

      • setBorder

        public void setBorder(org.bukkit.Material mat,
                      java.lang.String name)
        If the WindowType is set to Split_2 or Split_4, you can change the border material and name
        Parameters:
        mat - Material of the border
        name - Name of the Border

      • addItemStack

        public guiItem addItemStack(org.bukkit.Material mat,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            int slot)
        adds an ItemStack to the window
        Parameters:
        mat - Material of the Item
        name - Name of the Item
        slot - Slot the item is in (does not work if a border item is on that slot)
        Returns:
        Returns the created guiItem

      • setFillInv

        public void setFillInv(org.bukkit.Material mat)
        Set the FillMaterial for all empty slots of the inventory
        Parameters:
        mat - Material of the fill

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Unregisters the window from the Listeners so that the reference can be dumped

      • unregister

        public void unregister()
        unregisters the window, useful if you want to save on resources if the window has no need to listens to events for some time

      • getInv

        public org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory getInv()
        Returns:
        the inventory
